content:
That's fantastic to hear! It sounds like your snake plant is absolutely loving its new home and the extra attention. The vibrant leaves and new shoots are a clear indication that the repotting has done wonders for its health.

The new watering schedule you've implemented seems to be spot on as well. Snake plants do prefer consistent moisture, especially when they're actively growing. Watering every 4-5 days is a great frequency, as it allows the soil to dry out slightly between waterings, which helps prevent root rot and encourages healthy growth.

It's also possible that the plant was slightly water-stressed before, which can cause the leaves to become dull and limp. Now that it's receiving the right amount of moisture, the leaves are perking up and looking more vibrant.

The new shoots are a great sign of the plant's renewed energy and vitality. Snake plants can produce new growth quite quickly, especially when they're happy and healthy. You might even notice that the new leaves are slightly different in color or texture than the older ones, which is a normal part of the plant's growth cycle.

Remember to keep an eye on the plant's growth and adjust your watering schedule as needed. As the plant continues to grow, its watering needs might change, so be prepared to increase or decrease the frequency of watering accordingly.

Also, don't forget to fertilize your snake plant periodically to provide it with essential nutrients. A balanced, water-soluble fertilizer applied during the growing season (spring and summer) will help support its growth and development.

Keep up the great work, and enjoy watching your snake plant continue to thrive!
